meanings.sent1: After working for many years, he finally became pensionable.
meanings.sent2: She reached the pensionable age and started receiving her retirement benefits.
meanings.sent3: The pensionable cat retired from catching mice and now naps all day.
meanings.sent4: The old tree in the park was so pensionable, it seemed to whisper tales of the past.
meanings.sent5: The idea of being pensionable one day motivated him to save money for the future.

meanings.sent1: The new employees were excited to become pensionable after completing the probation period.
meanings.sent2: Only permanent staff are pensionable in this company.
meanings.sent3: The robot proved to be pensionable after years of loyal service in the factory.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the job made her pensionable in the eyes of her employer.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out tools were no longer pensionable and had to be replaced.
